revised_title: Nutritional Biochemistry and Trace Elements in Sheep: Overcoming Deficiencies
tldr: The author discusses the organization and work of the Division of Biochemistry and General Nutrition of C.S.I.R., focusing on their research on the nutritional biochemistry of sheep and the role of trace elements in their health. The division discovered that sheep grazing on deficient soils suffered from a dual deficiency of cobalt and copper, which could be resolved by supplementing their diet with these elements. This research led to improvements in the health and productivity of sheep in challenging environments.
